      • maximizes

        public static £.SwingUtils maximizes(£.Effect speedEffect,
                                     javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                     int maximum_width,
                                     int maximum_height)
        This method maximizes the frame. The supported effects are all speed effects.
        The effects allowed are the following:
        • £.Effect.SLOW
        • £.Effect.REALLY_SLOW
        • £.Effect.FAST
        • £.Effect.REALLY_FAST
        • £.Effect.SUPER_FAST
        • £.Effect.IMPERCEPTIBLE

        Parameters:
        speedEffect - a speed effect
        frame - the frame
        maximum_width - destination width
        maximum_height - destination height
        Returns:
        the SwingUtils instance

      • moveJFrame

        public static £.SwingUtils moveJFrame(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                      int x,
                                      int y,
                                      £.Effect effect,
                                      £Func func)
        This method moves the frame

        The method is fine only if it is not used: setLocationRelativeTo(null);

        The supported effects are all speed effects.

        The effects allowed are the following:
        • £.Effect.SLOW
        • £.Effect.REALLY_SLOW
        • £.Effect.FAST
        • £.Effect.REALLY_FAST
        • £.Effect.SUPER_FAST
        • £.Effect.IMPERCEPTIBLE

        Parameters:
        frame - the frame you want to move
        x - the destination coordinate x
        y - the destination coordinate y
        effect - a speed effect
        func - the final function
        Returns:
        the SwingUtils home

      • moveJFrame

        public static £.SwingUtils moveJFrame(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                      int x,
                                      int y,
                                      £.Effect effect)
        This method moves the frame

        The method is fine only if it is not used: setLocationRelativeTo(null);

        • £.Effect.IMPERCEPTIBLE

        Parameters:

        x - the destination coordinate x
        y - the destination coordinate y
        effect - a speed effect
        Returns:
        the SwingUtils home

      • applyEffect

        public static £.SwingUtils applyEffect(£.Effect effect,
                                       javax.swing.JFrame... frames)
        This method assumes a default behavior. It is the method that decides the speed of the effects

        CAUTION - if you use the "crazy" effect, you enter in an infinite cicle

        The supported effects are : (CRAZY,MAXIMIZED,MINIMIZED,TRANSPARENCY)

        The effects allowed are the following:
        • £.Effect.CRAZY
        • £.Effect.MAXIMIZED
        • £.Effect.MINIMIZED
        • £.Effect.TRANSPARENCY

        Parameters:
        effect - a speed effect
        frames - the frames
        Returns:
        the SwingUtils home

        public static £.SwingUtils hide(javax.swing.JFrame jFram,

                                £Func func)

      • slide

        public static £.SwingUtils slide(javax.swing.JComponent comp,
                                 £.Effect slideAlign,
                                 £.Effect effect)
        This method performs the slide effect on a component. The effects allowed are the following:
        • £.Effect.SLOW
        • £.Effect.REALLY_SLOW
        • £.Effect.FAST
        • £.Effect.REALLY_FAST
        • £.Effect.SUPER_FAST
        • £.Effect.IMPERCEPTIBLE

        Parameters:
        comp - the component that acts as a slide
        slideAlign - alignment effect
        effect - a speed effect
        Returns:
        the swingUtils home

      • getSlideButton

        public static javax.swing.JButton getSlideButton(javax.swing.JComponent comp,
                                                 £.Effect slideAlign,
                                                 £.Effect effect)
        This method is interesting, returns a toggle button. The effects allowed are the following:
        • £.Effect.HORIZONTAL
        • £.Effect.VERTICAL

        Parameters:
        comp - comp the component that acts as a slide
        slideAlign - alignment effect
        effect - a speed effect
        Returns:
        the toggle button
